content: The "Mobile Informational Call Act of 2011" may be cited as the Act. Definitions are provided in Section 2. The "Mobile Informational Call Act of 2011" may be cited as the Act. Section 227(a) of the Communications Act of 1934 is amended to define an automatic telephone dialing system as equipment using a random or sequential number generator to produce and dial phone numbers. The term 'prior express consent' refers to the approval given by a person for a telephone call initiated by an entity with which they have an established business relationship, either when purchasing a good/service or at any point during the relationship. The term 'prior express consent' refers to approval given by a person for a telephone call initiated by an entity with which they have an established business relationship. Providing a telephone number as a means of contact evidences consent. Section 227(c)(1)(D) of the Communications Act of 1934 is amended by striking "subsection (a)(3)" and inserting "subsection (a)(5)". SEC. 3. INFORMATIONAL CALLS TO MOBILE TELEPHONE NUMBERS. The Communications Act of 1934 is amended to restrict calls made using automatic dialing systems or prerecorded voices to emergency lines or hospital/patient rooms without prior consent. The Communications Act of 1934 is amended to restrict calls made using automatic dialing systems or prerecorded voices to emergency lines or hospital/patient rooms without prior consent. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to Section 227(b)(2)(C) of the Act. The Communications Act of 1934 is amended to restrict calls made using automatic dialing systems or prerecorded voices to emergency lines or hospital/patient rooms without prior consent. Section 227(b)(1) is amended to make it unlawful for any person within the United States, or any person outside the United States if the recipient is within the United States. Section 227(f)(1) of the Communications Act of 1934 is amended to prohibit any state laws from imposing requirements or prohibitions on subjects regulated under this section, except for telephone solicitations.
